abstract: The small but unexpected rally by the renminbi was interpreted as a signal that the Chinese central bank might be willing to tolerate a faster rate of appreciation against the dollar.
snippet: The small but unexpected rally by the renminbi was interpreted as a signal that the Chinese central bank might be willing to tolerate a faster rate of appreciation against the dollar.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China’s currency staged a small but unexpected rally this week, as the country’s central bank allowed it to rise 0.72 percent against the dollar, with most of the move coming Wednesday and Thursday.

headline.main: Chinese Let Currency Rise Against the Dollar
headline.print_headline: Chinese Let Currency Rise Against The Dollar
